job description:
Duties:
•Provide routine analytical support (HPLC analysis) using established analytical methods for nonclinical studies.
•Perform HPLC analytical method development and validation with supervision.
•Ability to accurately record data and experiments in a clear concise manner and compliant with GLP (21CFR58) regulations.
•Familiar with peer review and able to address audits from quality assurance.
•Follow established procedures and work in an organized and safe manner.
•May utilize other chromatographic techniques as needed.
•May perform other techniques for characterization of nonclinical formulations (such as DSC, dissolution, and solubility testing) as needed.

Skills:
•Familiarity with Agilent HPLC instrumentation.
•Ability to interpret and review chromatographic data using software systems such as Waters Empower 3.
•Self-motivated worker with the ability to complete projects in an efficient and high quality manner.
•Good communication skills and ability to easily interface with team members to complete tasks.
•Adaptable to a fast-paced environment and flexible to complete urgent tasks upon short notice.


Education:
Bachelors Degree in Analytical Chemistry or related field.
At least two-three years related industry experience in a quality control environment (GMP/GLP) or equivalent
